publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_description: Biallelic AAGGG intronic repeat expansions in RFC1
donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS)

genomic_modifications.description: Biallelic AAGGG intronic repeat expansions in RFC1 present in the donor (patient-derived variant)

genomic_characterisation.summary: SNP array (0.5 Mb resolution / Illumina GSA-24 v2.0) indicated a normal female karyotype 46,XX with no aneuploidies or large deletions/insertions detected.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K; pEP4 E02S EN2L; pEP4 E02S EM2K; pSimple-miR302/367 (episomal plasmids listed in Methods/Table 2)

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Royal Children's Hospital
